abstract.p: Dr Timothy McCall letter on health care costs; points out that about 25 percent of cost is for administration of inherently inefficient insurance system (S)

block.p: ''Health Providers and Elderly Clash on Medicare Funds'' (front page, May 15) shows how successful efforts have been to divide and conquer within our health care system. We must stop flogging the dead horse of market-based solutions.

''Health Providers and Elderly Clash on Medicare Funds'' (front page, May 15) shows how successful efforts have been to divide and conquer within our health care system. We must stop flogging the dead horse of market-based solutions.

About 25 percent of our health care expenditures go to administration, largely because of the inherent inefficiencies of our insurance system. Other industrialized countries provide universal care for a fraction of this amount. It's our small-minded refusal to examine models of care from around the world and adapt them to American circumstances that prevents us from solving our health care crisis.
TIMOTHY MCCALL, M.D. Cambridge, Mass., May 15, 2000
The writer is executive director of the Ad Hoc Committee to Defend Health Care.
